intro: Comesperma planifolium, commonly known as the flat-leaf comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in spring. The species is adapted to dry environments and is often found in heathlands and open forests.
